description: Dive into "Beaches of Cascais: Sun, Surf, and Serenity" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Beaches of Cascais: Sun, Surf, and Serenity

places.generalDescription: Praia de S√£o Pedro do Estoril is a stunning coastal area in Portugal, known for its golden sands and clear waters that attract both tourists and locals. The beach is nestled in a sheltered bay, offering excellent conditions for surfing and swimming. Its dramatic cliffs provide a picturesque backdrop covered in lush greenery, adding to the natural beauty of the area. Visitors can enjoy board rentals and restaurants along the boardwalk while taking in views from the adjoining rocky clifftop.

sources.snippet: Pedro do Estoril is a charming beach situated in the Estoril area of Cascais. With its golden sands and tranquil atmosphere, it offers a peaceful getaway from the business of Lisbon. The beach is known for its stunning views of the Atlantic Ocean and the picturesque coastal cliffs.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal: Beach Guide

places.name: Praia de S√£o Pedro do Estoril

reviews.text: Very nice beach! Close to the train station and places to eat. Also on top of the beach there is a nice terrace to eat and drink a cold beer while the sun sets!
Nice little beach with surfing options.
Really nice beach with a local feel and 2 restaurants that offer a superb relaxed experience.

places.generalDescription: Praia do Guincho is a renowned beach that has gained fame for being a prime spot for surfing, windsurfing, and kite surfing. It also holds significance as a filming location for a James Bond movie. The surrounding area of Guincho offers an array of excellent dining options, including the prestigious Michelin-starred Fortaleza do Guincho. Additionally, the region in central Portugal boasts various wine regions such as Bucelas, Carcavelos, and Colares.

sources.snippet: Unlike most beaches in and around Cascais, Praia do Guincho directly faces the Atlantic Ocean and the epic waves make it a popular surfing destination for experienced surfers. The strong winds also make it popular for windsurfing and kitesurfing, but less suitable for sunbathing. Praia do Guincho is mainly accessible by car ‚Äì it‚Äôs just a 20-minute drive to the beach from Cascais ‚Äì or it‚Äôs possible to cycle along a purpose-built cycle path.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Cascais, Portugal

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs windy but beautiful and perfect for surfing and windsurfing (which is why it has hosted international championships). It‚Äôs also the biggest beach in Cascais, and its location about 6km (4 miles) from the center of town, in the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park, means it‚Äôs never crowded. It remains a wild beach, with dunes of powdery sand and surrounded by Mediterranean vegetation, and was a backdrop for an opening scene in a James Bond movie ("On Her Majesty‚Äôs Secret Service‚Äù).
sources.shortName: Top 10 Cascais Must-See Attractions and Things to Do

sources.snippet: Praia do Guincho is known for its beauty and powerful waves, making it a paradise for surfers and windsurfers. The beach is located within the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park, providing a stunning backdrop of rolling dunes and scenic cliffs. Over the years, it has also become a popular spot for dining among celebrities like Bill Clinton and Brad Pitt, who enjoy its seafront restaurants, which continue to be cherished destinations year-round for locals.
sources.shortName: Cascais Insider Guide: 5 Must-Visit Beaches for the Summer

sources.snippet: Praia do Guincho, located on the western coast of Portugal near Cascais, is renowned for its stunning natural beauty and powerful Atlantic waves. This expansive sandy beach is framed by rolling dunes and rugged cliffs, offering a dramatic landscape that attracts surfers, windsurfers, and kite surfers from around the world. Known for its strong winds and impressive surf, Guincho is a hotspot for water sports enthusiasts.
sources.shortName: Guide to the 12 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal

sources.snippet: The largest and most beautiful beach in Cascais preserves a wild, well-protected landscape. Backed by large dunes and the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park, it‚Äôs windy but one of the best in Portugal for water sports, particularly surfing and windsurfing. Due to its rather remote location in the 1940s, it was a popular escape for international celebrities like Walt Disney, Evita Per√≥n, and Grace Kelly.
sources.shortName: CASCAIS BEACHES - Best Beach Guide 2024

sources.snippet: Praia do Guincho is one of the most sought-after beach locations in the area, offering a wide stretch of sandy beach and some of Cascais‚Äô most luxurious accommodation and restaurants. Surfing and windsurfing are popular pastimes on the Praia do Guincho but watch out for strong currents and be sure only to swim when the resident lifeguard is on duty.
sources.shortName: Cascais Beaches - Things to do Cascais Portugal

sources.snippet: You can‚Äôt miss out on Praia do Guincho if you‚Äôre a nature lover or a surfer. It‚Äôs tucked away amidst rugged cliffs and wild dunes, giving it a unique beauty that feels a lot more remote than the other Cascais beaches. The waves here are strong, making it a hot spot for surfers, and the wide space of golden sand offers plenty of room for sunbathers.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches in Cascais this Summer

sources.snippet: GPS: 38.73098, -9.47262 Station: None close Praia da Guincho is 8km to the north of Cascais so is technically not in the Estoril coastline but is so great that it needs to be listed. Guincho beach faces a westerly direction and is pounded by massive Atlantic Ocean waves, ideal for experienced surfers. The stunning landscape of Guincho beach
sources.shortName: The beaches between Lisbon and Cascais (The Estoril Coastline)

sources.snippet: Praia do Guincho is the first of the major breaks that face west across the Atlantic Ocean. That means it gets WAY more swell than its compadres on the south. However, that also means it‚Äôs exposed to all the autumn and winter onshores, which can blow the whole place out in a jiffy.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Guide to Cascais Surfing

sources.snippet: Guincho Beach is renowned for its rolling waves and breathtaking scenery. Its strong winds make this beach a haven for surfers and nature lovers alike. The wild beauty of this beach makes it a must-visit for those seeking an adrenaline rush or a peaceful retreat amidst nature.
sources.shortName: 27 Most Stunning Cascais Portugal Beaches (2024)

sources.snippet: Praia do Guincho is a favorite among families and surfers alike. Known for its powerful waves, it's an ideal spot for surfing. The beach is large, offering plenty of space for everyone, but be prepared to walk a bit from the parking area to the shore.
sources.shortName: Ultimate Guide to the Best Beaches in Cascais

sources.snippet: From Guincho to Estoril, with the village of Cascais in the center, the offer is complete and diverse on all beaches. From sea conditions to the size of the beach, you will discover which of the best beaches in Cascais is your favorite.

sources.snippet: Inside the Serra de Sintra nature park sits Praia do Guincho. Renowned for its powerful waves, it attracts surfers, windsurfers, and nature enthusiasts. Here, you‚Äôll find dunes that gradually rise toward towering cliffs in the north.

sources.snippet: Praia do Guincho is a popular surfing and windsurfing beach adjacent to Praia do Abano. It's located in a dune zone and often experiences strong northerly winds. However, it can be dangerous for inexperienced swimmers.

places.name: Praia do Guincho

reviews.text: Had an accidental encounter with a local dude that showed me this place after the bus couldn't drive to Cabo Raso because it was devastated by the storm. Was a real pleasure to meet him and a cool thing that just by that I came across this scenic beach.

This beach is absolutely stunning! It's so big and wide that you feel amazed. The water is very cold, at least for us because we couldn't swim in it. Also there are big waves so it's not a friendly beach because it's a little dangerous to swim here, but it's perfect for people doing water sports which are all over the place! I strongly recommend this wild beach experience!

It's spacious like a desert! So even you go in the summer time it's still not packed and you can easily find a quiet space for yourself

The water isn't too cold but very wavy. So it's good for surfing

Easy to access by the bus from Cascais

places.generalDescription: Praia da Parede, a charming beach nestled in Cascais, is a delightful destination for those seeking both relaxation and adventure. The beach is sheltered by a tall wall, providing protection from the wind, while a lovely raised esplanade runs alongside it, leading to inviting cafes and restaurants that offer stunning views. Known for its strong waves, Praia da Parede attracts surfers and families alike; lifeguards are on duty to ensure safety.

sources.snippet: Praia da Parede, meaning ‚Äúwall‚Äù in Portuguese, is indeed backed by a tall wall which provides excellent shelter from the wind. Additionally, a raised esplanade runs alongside the beach, leading to a charming caf√© at one end. Parede is a favored spot for fishing, with anglers frequently seen casting off from its shores.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal: Beach Guide

places.name: Praia da Parede

reviews.text:
Nice, beautiful sand beach.
The beach is not very large but is clean and comfortable.Easy to access and nice parking near by.The beach is not crowded.Sun umbrellas üèñ ( all day 15‚Ç¨ ).
Toilet üöª ( open till 19:00).bar and restaurant decent price.Sand is clean. Perfect for family with children.Beautiful sunset ‚ù§Ô∏è
Very nice and quiet beach - some good restaurants
My first Portuguese beach which I spent  so much time on in 1977.  Went back over many years.  Much cleaner sea and Beach now. They have made a wonderful  upgrade.

places.generalDescription: Carcavelos beach is a bustling and popular destination known for its vast expanse of golden sands, clean sea waters, and excellent tourist facilities. Located just a short train ride from central Lisbon, it offers a vibrant atmosphere with nearby shops, restaurants, bars, and stores selling surfing gear. This beach is particularly favored by surfers, windsurfers, and bodyboarders due to its ideal conditions.

sources.shortName: The Best Beaches Along the Cascais Coast for a Dip This Summer

sources.snippet: The most urban beach in cascais area, but also the one that has the best conditions for surfing, especially during the winter time. Being a big beach with several bars and restaurants nearby this is a very crowded beach during the summer months. During the winter months is our favorite playground and where we give most of our surf lessons!
sources.shortName: BEST BEACHES IN CASCAIS - SALTY SOULS SURF SCHOOL

sources.snippet: Carcavelos beach is the first municipal beach we find when coming from Lisbon. It has a large expanse of sand and is much sought after by surfers, windsurfers and body boarders. There is a pedestrian area surrounding the beach, where you can find many restaurants, bars and outdoor coffee shops.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais along the Lisbon Coast

places.name: Carcavelos beach

reviews.text: Very wide sandy beach. Very clean water, but cold. Really nice spot for taking the sun and relax. Hard to find free parking spot. Recommend that place.

Very easy to access from Lisboa by the train; also very affordable to go. The beach goes all the way, so you can manage to find a spot for yourself even though it is crowded.
The beach has light colored sand. You can enjoy the sun on the beach, swim, or even try surfing. There are several surf schools here or places that you can just rent a surfboard.
There are also some private beaches there, they seem to be mostly empty.

Best to get there by car. The beach is too narrow. The water gets too deep too soon for small kids to play inside . Also the water was abit too cold for summer time. Otherwise it was clean, clean bathrooms available nearby and also not so crowded.

places.generalDescription: Praia Nossa Senhora da Conceicao, located in Cascais, is a popular and centrally located beach known for its bustling atmosphere. It is ideal for sunbathing, paddleboarding in calm waters, and enjoying drinks at seaside bars. The beach offers various amenities such as lifeguards, bathrooms, showers, rentals, and a bar/restaurant. Its tranquil waters make it suitable for swimming and it is well-equipped to cater to families with children.

sources.snippet: Praia da Concei√ß√£o boasts some of the calmest waters on the coastline around Cascais and Lisbon, making it ideal for families with young children and for stand-up paddleboarding. It‚Äôs one of the largest beaches in the region and at low tide is connected to the neighbouring Praia da Duquesa. Perched on a rocky outcrop at the west end of the beach you‚Äôll find the renowned Albatroz hotel, which was originally built in 1873 as a Palace for the Dukes of Loul√©.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Cascais, Portugal

sources.snippet:
The most central beach in Cascais is, naturally, the most crowded, but it‚Äôs perfect for sunbathing, to paddleboard on calm waters and to enjoy drinks at bars with sea views. sources.snippet: You will find Praia da Concei√ß√£o which marks the beginning of a 3 km walkway to Estoril, side by side with the sea and with several beaches to enjoy along the way. It is the first of this trip, where the waves are small and sailboats sail through the landscape. It is next to the Hotel Albatroz, whose terrace can make your afternoon at the lightest and most relaxed time of the week.

sources.snippet: This beach is connected with Duquesa Beach at low tide forming one of the largest beaches in Portugal. On either end, you will find impressive landmarks including the Casa Faial, a well-known palace in Cascais, and the luxurious Albatroz hotel on the other. The beach is protected by Cascais Bay, bringing in calm waters and low currents making it a great family beach.

sources.snippet: The main reason most people head to Cascais is for a day at the beach. Praia da Concei√ß√£o is the one closest to the train station and also one of the best beaches on the Lisbon coast for some sunbathing and to get your feet wet. Overlooked by mansions, it‚Äôs the starting point of an oceanfront promenade that goes past several other beaches all the way to Estoril.

sources.snippet: Praia da Concei√ß√£o is situated between the Albatroz and Charlet hotels, close to the train station. The beach is well-maintained, with lifeguards and medical staff on duty, as well as essential facilities like toilets, changing cabins, showers, and bars and cafes.

It‚Äôs the perfect spot for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking an active beach experience.

sources.snippet: From the peaceful shores of Praia da Concei√ßao to the lively beach parties at Praia da Duquesa, Cascais has something for everyone. sources.snippet: A great day in Cascais revolves around time spent soaking up the sun on one of its spectacular beaches. There are four beaches located within walking distance of the city center ‚Äì  Praia da Rainha, Praia da Concei√ß√£o, Praia da Duquesa, and Praia da Ribeira.

reviews.text: A nice beach to sit and relax.  It is only a few minutes walk from the train station.  When I was there in June, the water was freezing, so I did not get to go in, but the water looked gorgeous and must be really nice in the late summer months.  There's plenty of nearby shop and restaurants accessible nearby.
Beautiful beach for sunbathing but it is not ideal for swimming bcz the water is so cold even in the summer. Feel free here to find the place for you.

Beautiful beaches with fine golden sand and clear clean water. Being sunny Sunday afternoon the beaches were crowded but peaceful unlike some of the beaches in other location. There are a lot of shops and restaurants nearby for food and refreshments after a pleasant walk by the water.

places.generalDescription: Praia da Torre is a serene and family-friendly beach nestled near the Forte de Sao Juliao da Barra, adding a touch of history to your beach outing. This sheltered sandy beach offers picturesque views and is conveniently surrounded by restaurants, shops, and cafes. The highlight of this destination is the Piscina Oceanica de Oeiras, a vast ocean swimming pool with diving towers and a separate children's pool open from June to mid-September.

sources.snippet: Add a dose of history to your beach day at Praia da Torre, a sheltered sandy beach overlooked by the Forte de S√£o Juli√£o da Barra. The impressive 16th-century fortress is one of Portugal‚Äôs largest maritime fortifications and is considered the most important in the country. One of the defining features of the beach is Piscina Oce√¢nica de Oeiras, an enormous ocean swimming pool with diving towers and a dedicated children‚Äôs pool that‚Äôs open between June and mid-September.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Cascais, Portugal

sources.snippet:
GPS: 38.67553,-9.32316 Station: Carcavelos or Oeiras (both 1.5km walk) 
The Praia da Torre is a small but pretty beach, that stands in the shadow of the S√£o Juli√£o da Barra Fort. The beach is just to the east of Carcavelos beach and is a suitable option if the larger beach is crowded. As the Praia da Torre is on the estuary side of the fort the currents and waves are less powerful, therefore safer for children.

reviews.text: This beach was cute, a little nook tucked between some rocks, a marina, and an old national guard fort. I wanted to rent a surfboard after seeing how much fun everyone was having out there surfing. But alas settled for a relaxing sit and stroll along the water edge. I did, however, see one jellyfish that had washed ashore, so always be cautious of that potential.!!

Praia da Torre is a small but charming beach located in Oeiras, close to Lisbon. It is known for its calm waters, golden sand and a relaxed atmosphere that makes it popular among families and locals. The beach is framed by the Torre de S√£o Juli√£o da Barra, a historic fortress that gives it a unique and picturesque backdrop. It is easily accessible and offers good facilities, including nearby caf√©s and restaurants, making it convenient for spending a few hours by the sea. The water is generally calm, which makes it suitable for swimming and enjoying a peaceful day at the beach.
A stunning beach that includes numerous restaurants and a huge marina. Truly impressive! We can walk for more than 5 km along the shoreline along the boulevard.

places.generalDescription: Praia da Rainha, also known as Queens Beach, is a charming and intimate cove located in Cascais. Despite being one of the smallest beaches in the area, it boasts stunning golden sands surrounded by striking rock formations that overlook the Bay of Cascais. Its historical significance dates back to 1889 when it was a private retreat for Queen Amelia.

sources.snippet: This tiny, sandy cove sheltered by cliffs is located just a few minutes‚Äô walk from the centre of Cascais and the train station. The beach was once a favourite of Queen Am√©lia, the last queen of Portugal ‚Äì hence the name, which translates as Queen‚Äôs Beach ‚Äì and it‚Äôs one of the prettiest in the region. Its convenience and natural beauty mean it‚Äôs also one of the most popular beaches.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Cascais, Portugal

sources.snippet: One of the most famous beaches in Cascais is Praia da Rainha, or Queen's Beach, named after Queen Amelia, who used to frequent the golden sands for relaxation. The beach retains a regal air, with its clear waters and soft sand inviting visitors to bask in the sun like royalty. Each beach in Cascais has its own unique charm, from the family-friendly Praia da Conceicao to the surfers' paradise at Praia do Guincho, ensuring there's a spot for every beach lover to enjoy.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Cascais

sources.snippet: Its name (‚ÄúQueen‚Äôs Beach‚Äù) recalls the time when it was the private beach of Queen Am√©lia in the 1880s, but it‚Äôs now accessible to everyone. It‚Äôs small but the perfect Instagram beach, hidden between rocks and cliffs, right in the pedestrianized center of town. The calm, crystal-clear waters attract families with children, young couples, standup paddleboarders, and teenagers who love to jump off the rocks.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Cascais Must-See Attractions and Things to Do

sources.snippet: Praia da Rainha, also known as the ‚ÄòQueen‚Äôs Beach‚Äô, is a picturesque spot nestled in the heart of Cascais. Praia da Rainha holds historical significance as a favorite retreat of Portuguese royalty, particularly Queen Amelia who frequented it during the sunny days of the 1880s. Today, it remains a perfect destination for a relaxing seaside day, offering convenient access to the town‚Äôs centric spots.

sources.snippet: Royal Legacy: Praia da Rainha, which translates to "Queen's Beach," earned its name from Queen Amelia, the last queen of Portugal, who was known to frequent the secluded cove during her reign in the late 19th century. Today, the beach retains an air of regal elegance and exclusivity, with its sheltered waters and golden sands providing a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.

sources.snippet: Praia da Rainha, situated in the heart of Cascais, Portugal, is a charming and intimate beach known for its serene atmosphere and scenic beauty. This small cove, once the private beach of Queen Amelia, features golden sands and clear, calm waters. This makes it perfect for swimming and relaxing.
sources.shortName: Guide to the 12 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal

sources.snippet: Praia da Rainha, meaning ‚ÄúQueen‚Äôs Beach,‚Äù is a picturesque and enchanting beach located in Cascais. It‚Äôs named after Queen Am√©lia, who used to visit frequently. This Cascais beach is super popular since it‚Äôs the closest beach to the center of Cascais.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal: Beach Guide

sources.snippet: There are two beaches directly in town, Praia da Rainha and Praia da Ribeira. During the summer months (especially July and August), these beaches get pretty packed as everyone else decides a day trip to Cascais is a great idea too.
sources.shortName: A Day Trip to Cascais: The Best Beach Escape from Lisbon

sources.snippet: Praia da Rainha is a sandy beach accessible only via stairs. Located near the central area of Cascais and the train station, it was a favorite of Portugal's kings.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais: where to swim? Beach vacations in Cascais

sources.snippet: It is a very pretty but small beach that is surrounded by cliffs and overlooks the fishing harbor. It‚Äôs close to Cascais but can get very crowded.
sources.shortName: The beaches between Lisbon and Cascais
Lisbon to Cascais: A Day Trip From Lisbon to the Beach

places.name: Praia da Rainha

reviews.text:
This beach was a very nice choice. Even if the beach is tiny and there were a lot of people, we still did some space for us. They have free bathrooms where you can also change to your swimming suit which is a big plus. It's a sandy beach so don't worry for rocks or anything else because you don't need beach shoes. The water was a little cold but little by little we managed in the end to get in and it was amazing. You will fond very nice tiny golfs where you can swim between the rocks.

I strongly recommend this beach!

The closest beach to the Cascais train station like 5 minutes on foot. It is quite crowded but i could always find a spot. I was hesitant to go far to the next beach but this is cleaner than the others so staying here was the great choice!

This is a beautiful beach with a lot of character! We loved how it was nestled in a cove-like area, with the rock formations surrounding you, plus it is right beside all of the beautiful, old streets - you only need to walk down some steps and you're on the beach. We'll definitely come back here!

WARNING: When swimming, be mindful of the rocks in the water! Double-check before diving in.

Only con: The water didn't seem the cleanest. There was heaps of random bits in it - I can't fully describe what all the stuff was. We still had a great time swimming, but it did feel a tad gross with different things floating about.

However, we'd happily visit again! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

ALSO! We HIGHLY recommend buying a pina colada from this stall on the street, before you go down the steps to the beach. You're served a whole pineapple with the tastiest pina colada freshly made in the pineapple. Once you have purchased a pineapple you can go back for refills for ‚Ç¨5 per pineapple drink. It was soo nice having this on the beach ü§åüèº

places.generalDescription: Avencas Beach is a charming and beloved spot in Parede, Lisbon. It's a great place for families with kids as there are natural tide pools teeming with local wildlife to explore. The beach is surrounded by stunning cliffs and clear turquoise waters perfect for a refreshing swim. However, it's important to check the tide before visiting, as during low tide the beach can be rocky and unsuitable for swimming without proper footwear.

sources.snippet: Praia das Avencas is a sandy beach reachable only on foot, as the parking lot is located a distance away. There's a caf√© with the same name on the beach, making it convenient for visitors. The beach is suitable for scuba diving, offering a wealth of marine life to observe.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais: where to swim? Beach vacations in Cascais

places.name: Praia das Avencas

reviews.text: Nice beach and nice little cafeteria for drinks and snacks

This is a small sandy beach with a lovely pier for jumping into the sea and a natural rock pool nearby. It has a shower to rinse off the salt after swimming, which is a big plus. However, there's no toilet available to the public and no comfortable spot to change clothes, so keep that in mind.

On weekends, you'll likely find a spot, but expect to lie close to others-think sardines in a can. The beach is quite compact.

One important note: tides matter a lot here. The beach is partly rocky, and the natural pool area gets completely submerged at high tide. Be careful if you plan to swim there-conditions can change quickly. I highly recommend checking the tide forecasts before your visit.

I've been using the app Nautide: Mar√©s, Vendas, Ondes + for years, or you can use the website prilivy. For example, today's tide table shows a peak tide of 4.1 meters at 6:10 PM. That means the waves will be highest and most of the beach will be underwater around that time.

If you're heading to smaller beaches, try to plan your visit during low tide, when the coefficient is lowest-it makes a huge difference. I'm attaching a photo showing how completely the rocky part was flooded yesterday.

WARNING to all tourists against this house to rent from SPOTAHOME estate agent in PAREDE town, Portugal, near Lisboa and Cascais, on this street:

Rua Dr. Ant√≥nio C√¢ndido 5 , 2775-236 PAREDE.

HUGE SCAM

Landlord steals deposit money !! 500 Euros will be stolen from you.

Spotahome estate agency cooperates with him and shares the profit, so your money will never be returned.

Secondly, the room doesn't look like the photos on the Spotahome advert. I am attaching real photos here. There is a huge problem with fungi and mould in this house, giant spiders, ants, stench, renovation never completed, everything left halfway and not finished as the landlord suffers from mental illness borderline bipolar malignant narcissism personality disorder. He is extremely dangerous and nasty !

Also, electrical installation is broken, as is the toilet (flushes upwards ! ), shower, internet keep turning off due to a short circuit in the installation (owner wants to save even more money on a circuit that is not adapted to the building), so not even basic health and safety compliance.

Furthermore, enormous stress and constant discomfort due to grandiose malignant narcissistic entitled landlord, he isn't real Portuguese, he won't even welcome you with a tiny smile when you arrive. He will meet you with angry face at the doors as if he is making you favour that you pay him. He keeps entering and checking the house obsessively and watches the tenants, he has problems with anger control, has outbursts of aggression. Very unstable male, literally the most extreme psychosis entitlement I have seen so far.

There is no end to the problems, broken door handles, mold settles even on your private clothes in the wardrobe. Don't go to such small towns, people are backwards there, rent in Lisbon only, or Algarve only.

places.generalDescription: Tamariz Beach is a highly accessible spot, just a short walk from the train station to Lisbon and Cascais. The region boasts 18 beaches, offering plenty of options for beach lovers. During the summer months, Cascais experiences minimal rainfall in July and August with high average temperatures and around 10 hours of sun per day on average.

sources.snippet: Known for its gold-colored sand and turquoise blue waters, Tamariz should not be missed when visiting Cascais!. This beach has plenty of activities for everyone including restaurants and bars, a nightclub, tidepools, soft sand, and a scenic promenade that is great for running and walking on. Technically located in Estoril, this beach makes for a great starting point to explore both towns in one day!
sources.shortName: 10 Beautiful Beaches in Cascais & Estoril Near Lisbon

sources.snippet: A beach with excellent facilities, including a lifeguard, spas, restaurants, snack bars, outdoor coffee shop and water sports. It has an Atlantic swimming pool next to the existing pier. Very easily accessible via the Lisbon-Cascais train service, which stops right by the beach, as well as through the seaside promenade.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais along the Lisbon Coast

sources.snippet: Cascais is a captivating destination year-round, thanks to its abundant beauty. However, the ideal time to fully enjoy the best beaches in Cascais is when the weather starts to warm up. The beach season here typically runs from May to October, so it is very large.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Cascais and Estoril
The best beaches in Cascais

places.name: Tamariz Beach

reviews.text: The beach in Estoril offers a wonderful experience for visitors. The sand is pleasantly clean, making it ideal for relaxing or a barefoot stroll. There are designated paths for jogging and cycling, which add to the beach's charm, as they provide an active and enjoyable option for visitors. You'll also find water fountains and showers conveniently located, ensuring comfort and refreshment during your visit. The area feels very safe, making it a great destination for families and solo travelers alike. One of the highlights is the chance to observe the various seabirds along the shore-it's a serene and delightful experience. This beach is truly a gem that caters to both relaxation and recreation
Beautiful beach and water, but early june no sunbeds or umbrellas to rent. Some very simple bars/ restaurants. People trying their best, hopefully in the future services will be better

Tons of people on Sunday of August.
Still a nice place to visit and swim! Birds are awaiting u üòÅ

places.generalDescription: Cresmina Beach Bar is located in the natural park of Guincho, north of Cascais. The beach is less touristy and accessible, known for its vast sandy expanse and strong winds that create ideal conditions for surfing, kitesurfing, and windsurfing. Enclosed by rocky cliffs, it offers a spectacular view and can be reached from nearby Guincho Beach via a stairway and ramp.

sources.snippet: Before Guincho and the Fort, you‚Äôll find the smaller Guincho Beach, officially named Crismina but better known as Cresmina. Of great natural beauty, it‚Äôs characterised by strong waves and winds, leading to the formation of the ‚ÄúGuincho-Crismina‚Äù dune system, located in its surrounding area, as mentioned for Guincho Beach. It doesn‚Äôt have the same expanse of sand, but it‚Äôs ideal for families and offers views of the Crismina River mouth.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches Along the Cascais Coast for a Dip This Summer

sources.snippet: Guincho Beach: With its wide expanse of golden sand and powerful waves, Guincho Beach is a paradise for surfers and water sports enthusiasts. The strong winds that sweep across the coastline make it an ideal spot for windsurfing and kiteboarding, attracting athletes from around the world to test their skills against the elements. Framed by rugged cliffs and dunes, Guincho Beach offers a stunning backdrop for sunbathing, picnicking, and beachcombing, making it a popular destination for both locals and tourists alike.
sources.shortName: Discovering Paradise: The Most Beautiful Beaches Near Cascais

sources.snippet: A few meters away, but more hidden and reserved, you will find the Cresmina beach, which is also one of the best beaches in Cascais. It is the smallest beach in Guincho and is located between two rocks that can protect you from the wind for relaxing sunbathing. It is unmistakably beautiful and, like its neighbors in Guincho, is known for its strong undulation.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais

sources.snippet: Beautiful natural beach located in the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park with a large  expanse of sand and surrounded by cliffs. It is known for its strong swell and high winds which give rise to the ‚ÄúGuincho-Cresmina‚Äù dune system of great natural beauty and found throughout its surroundings.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais along the Lisbon Coast

places.name: Cresmina Beach Bar

reviews.text:
Such an amazing place! You won't regret going here! It's easy to travel to Guincho beach from Cascais Terminal, with the bus no 415 or hop on hop off bus.
The wind was quite strong, it's good the have a jacket or a hoodie when the sun is not shining.
The water has freezing cold (on June 13th), and the waves quite violent, but the view is spectacular. You can go swim wherever, but here the view is the main purpose. I let some pictures as a proof. üòâ

Cresmina beach in Guincho is excellent! If it's going to be hot in town get over here for cooler winds and a fully chilled vibe. It will be windy and the sea is rough so you'll need to come prepared. The bar offers great Tosta and hotdogs are popular, service is very relaxed so not a choice if you're in a rush, but come for the view, come for the vibe and stay until the sun sets over the ocean. Love it!

We did not eat, but fruit smoothies were fresh and yummy. It is a container type beach ‚Äúclub‚Äù with just a few tables to sit, but extremely clean and well maintained.

The beach is the most incredible experience. Praia da Cresmina is a stunning, peaceful beach near Cascais with golden sand, dramatic rocks, and clear Atlantic waves. Perfect for a swim (with waves), walking or soaking in nature's raw beauty. A hidden gem within the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park.

places.generalDescription: Praia da Azarujinha, also known as Azarujinhas Beach, is a stunning hidden gem nestled at the foot of coastal cliffs in Cascais. Its semi-circular shape and tranquil beauty make it a must-visit destination. Despite its secluded location, this picturesque beach offers various visitor facilities such as lifeguards, bars, restaurants, umbrellas and deck chairs for rent, showers, toilets, and accessibility for people with disabilities.

sources.snippet: The last of this trio, Praia da Azarujinha, or Azarujinha‚Äôs Beach, sits next to Praia da Po√ßa and is well worth making the trip for its dramatic yet tranquil beauty. Hidden from the road it is nestled at the foot of the main coastal cliff, which curves around it in a semi-circular shape. Like most of the well-tended beaches in the area, Praia da Azarujinha also boasts an on-site lifeguard with plenty of visitor facilities and a popular restaurant located right on the sands.
sources.shortName: Cascais Beaches - Things to do Cascais Portugal

sources.snippet: Praia da Azarujinha is a picturesque beach, shaped like a theater stage and nestled behind cliffs. Despite its hidden location, this beach offers all the comforts you need for a relaxing vacation, including bars, restaurants, an emergency room, lifeguards, umbrellas and deck chairs for rent, showers, toilets, and accessibility for people with disabilities. Fishing enthusiasts can also enjoy their sport here.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais: where to swim? Beach vacations in Cascais

sources.snippet: Best for: Families, TeenagersLifeguards: YesBathrooms: YesShowers: YesRentals: NoBar/Restaurant: NoAccessible: NoParking: NearbyNearest Train Station: S√£o Jo√£o do Estoril. Tucked away at the bottom of cliffs, this secluded beach is a peaceful spot for sunbathers and swimmers, offering a quiet refuge. It's also the last beach on the beachside walk that starts in the centre of Cascais and ends here.
sources.shortName: 27 Most Stunning Cascais Portugal Beaches (2024)

sources.snippet: Nestled between Praia da Duquesa and Praia da Azarujinha lies the picturesque Praia de Santa Marta. This quaint beach is known for its charming lighthouse, which adds a touch of history and character to the coastal landscape. With its calm waters and scenic views of the Atlantic Ocean, Praia da Santa Marta is the perfect spot to unwind and enjoy a leisurely day by the sea.
sources.shortName: Guide to the 12 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal

sources.snippet: The tour continues along the shores of the Atlantic Ocean and ends at Praia da Azarujinha. Throughout this route you will find a sea of ‚Äã‚Äãterraces, between bars and restaurants, which invite you to refreshing drinks and tasty meals with the best that Portuguese cuisine has to offer. The challenge is to take this route and choose your Top 3 of the best beaches in Cascais.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais

sources.snippet: Surrounded by high cliffs dotted with villas, resorts and palm trees, Praia da Azarujinhalies at the start of the promenade that stretches across Cascais. It‚Äôs a small, charming beach nestled between rocky cliffs, great for a seaside stroll.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal: Beach Guide

places.name: Praia da Azarujinha

reviews.text: Lovely little beach surrounded by high walls within 7min walk from S√£o Jo√£o de Estoril train station. There is not much sand, most of the shallow water bottom is covered by rock formations so you might want to bring your beach shoes. There is a good concrete area to stretch your beach towels that's got holes in the floor for beach umbrellas, though. The facilities include pretty clean restrooms, water fountain and a beach shower outside. The whole area gets covered by the sea in high tide.
One of my favorites in Cascais. Very small beach surrounded by high cliffs. Nice to seat down and relax. It can get very busy during summer time.
very crowded, tiny, and rocky beach. would not recommend

sources.snippet: Named for its distinctive cliff formation that divides the sandy strip in two, Praia da Arriba offers a unique coastal experience. Take caution when entering the water due to the numerous rocks surrounding each half of the beach. On the north side, a supervised pool awaits, overseen by the Arriba hotel perched atop the cliff.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal: Beach Guide
27 Most Stunning Cascais Portugal Beaches (2024)

reviews.text: Most beautiful sunset in November here. Such a romantic place!
A beautiful viewpoint of a beach area as one travels to Cascais, a historical fishing village.
So Uninhabited Cozy clean beach ‚ù§Ô∏è

places.generalDescription: Po√ßa Beach is a charming urban beach located in Estoril, offering a mix of sandy areas and rocky spots. Visitors can stroll along the promenade, known as Paredao, which runs between Cascais and Estoril, providing opportunities to relax at cafes and observe surfers and stand-up paddleboarders. The beach features a wide promenade with easy access and some rocky sections that reveal captivating rock pools during low tide.

sources.snippet: HOW TO GET THERE: It‚Äôs the same route as to Po√ßa Beach, which we‚Äôll talk about next, with just a few more steps. Alternatively, you can use the stairs accessed from Av. Marqu√™s de Leal (parallel to the Marginal).
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches Along the Cascais Coast for a Dip This Summer

sources.snippet: Cascais is a captivating destination year-round, thanks to its abundant beauty. However, the ideal time to fully enjoy the best beaches in Cascais is when the weather starts to warm up. The beach season here typically runs from May to October, so it is very large.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Cascais and Estoril
The best beaches in Cascais

places.name: Po√ßa Beach

reviews.text: Nice place to stop by and have a drink with a beautiful view of the ocean. You can rent a sun umbrella to hide in or a sunbed to sunbathe with little to no problem.

For me it was like a small and normal beach. As i walk alone, i couldnt take a bath because i didn't have anybody to keep my bag, so i can't say much about the water, but in general it felt like just an OK place, fully assisted, with lots of people together.

It was kinda crowded when i went there and that was all.

I would go there again only with friends. For lone riders there are better options.
Too small, but good for kids

places.generalDescription: Praia da Duquesa, along with Praia da Conceicao, forms the main beach of Cascais. It is larger than Praia do Tamariz and offers a variety of activities such as boat rides, sea inflatables, pedalos, and beach sports. The beach is conveniently located just a 5-minute walk from the train station. With its golden sands and calm waters, it's an ideal spot for families.

sources.snippet: The two beaches of Praia da Duquesa and Praia da Concei√ß√£o form the main beach of Cascais, the next resort town along from Estoril. This beach is larger than the Praia do Tamariz and is always more hectic, offering many activities such as boat rides, sea inflatables, pedalos and beach sports. The beach is divided in two by a minor headland on which the Casa Faial villa stands; to the west is the Praia da Concei√ß√£o, and to the east (closer to Estoril) is the Praia da Duquesa.
sources.shortName: Estoril beach guide and best beaches in 2024

sources.snippet: Best for: Swimming, Paddling, Walks by the seaLifeguards: YesBathrooms: YesShowers: NoRentals: YesBar/Restaurant: YesAccessible: NoParking: NearbyNearest Train Station: Cascais. Just next door to Praia de Concei√ß√£o, Duquesa beach is a favorite among locals and visitors. Praia da Duquesa boasts fine sands and calm waters, flanked by elegant mansions that add to its majestic beauty.
sources.shortName: 27 Most Stunning Cascais Portugal Beaches (2024)

sources.snippet: Praia da Duquesa sits side by side with Concei√ß√£o Beach and connects with it via a small channel at low tide. Praia da Duquesa is named after the Palace of Palmela‚Äôs Dukes, which overlooks its shores. The beach offers great diving conditions with clean, calm waters providing excellent visibility as well as being a popular sailing and windsurfing spot just like its neighbour.
sources.shortName: Cascais Beaches - Things to do Cascais Portugal

sources.snippet: This beach is very close to the train station making it easily accessible for those lugging all of their beach and travel gear with them on the train. You‚Äôll often find cute tiki umbrellas, lounge chairs, and crystal clear waters here!. It gets very busy in the summer, but is quite beautiful and should be on your list of beaches to visit.
sources.shortName: 10 Beautiful Beaches in Cascais & Estoril Near Lisbon

sources.snippet: If you're looking for another family favorite, look no further than Praia da Duquesa. With its gentle waves and soft sand, this beach provides the perfect setting for building sandcastles and enjoying a day by the sea. It even has a playground and plenty of space for picnics, ensuring a fun-filled outing for the whole family.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Cascais

sources.snippet:
GPS: 38.70054, -9.41558 Station: Cascais 
The Duquesa and Concei√ß√£o beaches comprise of the largest stretch of sand within walking distance of Cascais. The two beaches are separated by a small headland with the Praia da Concei√ß√£o on the western side, closest to Cascais. These are popular beaches during the summer.
sources.shortName: The beaches between Lisbon and Cascais (The Estoril Coastline)

sources.snippet: Located between the ‚ÄúChalet Faial‚Äù and the Nossa Senhora da Concei√ß√£o Chapel , this beach is not very extensive, and connects to the Duquesa Beach when the tide is low. Access to the beach is easy via the seaside promenade, stairs and ramp. There are restaurants, bars and outdoor coffee shops along the walkway.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais along the Lisbon Coast

sources.snippet: From the peaceful shores of Praia da Concei√ßao to the lively beach parties at Praia da Duquesa, Cascais has something for everyone. So pack your sunscreen and towels, because we‚Äôre about to embark on a beach adventure like no other. This blog post is a guide to the 12 best beaches in Cascais Portugal.
sources.shortName: Guide to the 12 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal

sources.snippet: Praia da Duquesa is derives its name from the nearby Palace of the Dukes of Palmela. Alongside Praia de Concei√ß√£o, it‚Äôs the most conveniently reached beach from the train station, making it a great spot for anyone looking to make a quick visit. Just keep in mind it gets pretty busy in the summertime!
sources.shortName: 17 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal: Beach Guide

sources.snippet: The mansion on the eastern end of Praia da Concei√ß√£o marks the beginning of this similar beach. It‚Äôs named after the Duchess of Palmela, who lived in the other large mansion, on its eastern side. It has crystal-clear water, boat and parasol rentals, and can get packed in the summer.
sources.shortName: CASCAIS BEACHES - Best Beach Guide 2024

sources.snippet: It's an excellent beach for diving, with a diving school available, and boasts clean, clear waters with good visibility. You can rent a yacht or try your hand at windsurfing here, and all the typical beach amenities are provided.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais: where to swim? Beach vacations in Cascais

sources.snippet: There are four beaches located within walking distance of the city center ‚Äì  Praia da Rainha, Praia da Concei√ß√£o, Praia da Duquesa, and Praia da Ribeira.
sources.shortName: Lisbon to Cascais: A Day Trip From Lisbon to the Beach

places.name: Praia da Duquesa

reviews.text: Beautiful beach in Porto. Water was cold end of August but plenty of people were still swimming. Water sport opportunities available.
I went in April and it was nice and warm but beware the sea is a little dirty. Nothing I can't handle though! Very busy spring break but it was fun and everyone was loving it!!

Nice beach to spend a few hours, the sand is nice and clean and the water is a bit warmer than other places, it's not clear though. The worst thing about the beach was how hot the sand was when walking off and on the boardwalks, you must wear sandals or burn your feet like I did!

places.generalDescription: Hotel Albatroz Cascais is a charming beachside boutique hotel located on Conceicao beach, known for its elegant rooms and suites. Originally a 1960s inn with just ten rooms, it has now expanded to offer luxurious accommodations decorated in soothing shades of green, blue, and beige. The hotel's cliffside setting provides stunning views of the ocean, and guests can enjoy fine dining at the Albatroz restaurant while taking in the sunset from the bar/lounge area.

sources.snippet: This romantic hotel occupies the mansion that stands between Praia da Concei√ß√£o and Praia da Rainha. It offers scenic views from just about anywhere, including most of the rooms, the restaurant and the terrace with swimming pool. More Details and Prices
sources.shortName: CASCAIS BEACHES - Best Beach Guide 2024

places.name: Hotel Albatroz Cascais

reviews.text: Amazing hotel!! Service was 5 stars. Room was nice and spacious and the pool area is amazing. Great bar and restaurants. Delicious breakfast included. We loved our stay here. Can look out on the ocean and beach while laying at the pool. Location is centrally located and you can easily walk to cascais restaurants

My husband and I recently had our welcome party for our wedding at the Hotel Albatroz. We are so happy we did; it truly was as big of a highlight as the wedding itself. First, the hotel's location on the beach is stunning. The Dom Carlos room has enormous windows that provided our guests the most wonderful, beautiful view. We worked with Marta, who we cannot recommend highly enough. She worked incredibly diligently to ensure every detail of our event went smoothly. She helped us coordinate rental furniture and flower arrangement delivery. She was professional, responsive to emails, and genuine. We felt very supported and heard by her and her team.

The welcome party was perfect. We cannot say enough amazing things about the FOOD. Everyone loved it. Nobody was bored. The bartenders were professional and quick to make sure people had a drink. We were able to choose several signature cocktails which our guests loved. If you are getting married in or around Cascais we highly recommend the Hotel Albatroz as a potential rehearsal dinner / welcome party space!!

Overall, it was a really good stay. The hotel has a lot of charm, and the interior decoration is tasteful, elegant, and clearly looked after. The location is perfect. You're right on the water with easy access to the center of Cascais. The restaurant is exceptional. Easily one of the best meals I've had in the area. Service was excellent throughout, very attentive without being overbearing.

A couple of things could be better. The corridors aren't well soundproofed. You can hear people talking like they're standing inside your room, at least on the floor we were on. Also, the water in the bathrooms gets way too hot, to the point of being uncomfortable.

Still, it's a solid hotel. I'd come back, but I'd book a quieter room.  The one we booked was one of the last available on Expedia.

places.generalDescription: Praia de Pa√ßo de Arcos is the largest beach in Paco de Arcos, featuring golden sands and a tranquil atmosphere along the Lisbon coastline. It offers a mix of wavy and calm waters, making it enjoyable for swimming. The clean restroom and periodic beach showers add to the convenience. Nearby, Praia das Fontainhas boasts a rugged coastline.

sources.snippet:
GPS: 38.69031, -9.29647 Station: Pa√ßo de Arcos
The Praia de Pa√ßo de Arcos is the largest beach of Pa√ßo de Arcos. This beach has golden sands and is one of the better, quieter beaches of the Lisbon coastline. Close by is the craggy coastline of the Praia das Fontainhas.
sources.shortName: The beaches between Lisbon and Cascais (The Estoril Coastline)

sources.snippet: The Praia de Pa√ßo de Arcos is the largest beach of Pa√ßo de Arcos. This beach exhibits golden sands and is one of the calmer beaches of the Lisbon shoreline. Close by is the craggy coastline of the Praia das Fontainhas.
sources.shortName: The beaches between Lisbon and Cascais

places.name: Praia de Pa√ßo de Arcos

reviews.text: Nice place but no restaurants. Recommend 5 star.
Nice beach but the sand here is very sticky. There is a shower area and beautiful walking track.
Beautiful beach. Very nice place to relax .A shame it doesn't have public restrooms-only the one at the bar.

places.generalDescription: Praia do Abano is a small but stunning beach located in Alcabideche, belonging to Cascais. It is an extension of Guincho beach and offers similar weather conditions with white powdery sand. Despite the sand sometimes flying on rough days, many visitors love Praia do Abano for its untouched beauty and as a perfect spot for a peaceful walk amidst natural surroundings.

sources.snippet: A hidden gem, Praia do Abano offers a tranquil escape with its secluded sands and mesmerizing sunsets. Perfect for those looking to unwind and soak up the serene atmosphere. A short hike down from Guincho, but you‚Äôll escape the tourists and have more peace to enjoy nature.
sources.shortName: 27 Most Stunning Cascais Portugal Beaches (2024)

sources.snippet: Praia do Abano is a sandy beach known for its noisy sea and strong winds. It offers all the essentials for a beach vacation, although parking can be a challenge. Praia do Abano is well-suited for surfing and fishing.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais: where to swim? Beach vacations in Cascais

sources.snippet: Praia do Abano is a secluded beach nestled along the Cascais coastline. This beach is best known for its unique rock formations which create small natural pools during low tide. This beach was my absolute favorite.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal: Beach Guide

places.name: Praia do Abano

reviews.text: Beautiful secret beach, a place to be alone with nature. There are some hiking trails starting from the beach. Not for swimming though.

I would like to make sure people know that this is not a beach. This is a cliff with stairs to go down where you will find only big rocks and pebbles without sand. We read several reviews going there which I honestly think are misleading. We visited the place with the expectation to spend few hours just to find out that there is no beach at all to seat or lay back. This is a beautiful cliff with amazing  views, but the entire place is filled with rocks and no sand. Also, trying to get in the water can be dangerous due to the waves.
If you are looking for a naturist beach, I strongly recommend Praia 19.

Beautiful view, but very windy, small area. I would invite my girlfriend to spend time there, because it seems to me this beach is kinda romantic, so it will not suit for a company of friends. And also to get there you have to pass some kilometers of off-road.

places.generalDescription: Santa Marta Beach in Cascais, Portugal is a picturesque and unique spot that has become a favorite among visitors. Accessible by clambering down the rocks, this little slice of heaven features a narrow stretch of protected waters underneath an old stone bridge. At high tide, the beach is submerged underwater, but when the tides recede, a small golden sand area emerges where visitors can relax.

sources.snippet: Situated beneath the Santa Marta Lighthouse and Museum, this charming beach is a hidden gem accessible only during low tide. Despite its small size, I found it to be a totally worthwhile visit, offering a tranquil escape from the crowded beaches. With its cool and clear waters, adorned with a combination of sandy patches and algae-covered rocks, it had such a picturesque setting.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal: Beach Guide

sources.snippet: This beach has a very small sandy area, and is right next to the Cascais Marina. In this bathing area, where the river Mochos joins the sea, one can observe the natural and architectural beauty of the surrounding areas. Perfect beach to go with small children.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Cascais along the Lisbon Coast

places.name: Praia de Santa Marta

reviews.text: Very beautiful, but when we went there was a lot of seaweed and the water was very cold. However, once you've been in for a while, it gets better and you start to enjoy it. A great spot for taking photos if you're visiting Cascais, Portugal.

For me this is the best exciting place in cascais .
-The beach is magical and gives you a fantasy feeling.
-The surrounding buildings add charm to the beach and the high tide is fun.
**The only negative is that the place is narrow.
Beautiful, but more for sun bathing as the water is ice cold (was there late July). Gets crowded quickly.

places.address: 2750, Av. Rei Humberto II de It√°lia 7, Cascais, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Praia da Ribeira de Cascais is a stunning beach located in the charming Portuguese village of Cascais, known for its high quality of life and abundant sunshine. This picturesque destination offers a perfect blend of unspoiled nature and sophistication, making it an ideal spot for both adventurous getaways and family vacations. The area boasts miles of pristine shoreline, including the nearby beaches of Praia de Carcavelos, Praia da Conceicao, and Praia Rainha.

sources.snippet: Best for: Sports, Families/ChildrenLifeguards: NoBathrooms: NoShowers: NoRentals: NoBar/Restaurant: NearbyAccessible: NoParking: NearbyNearest Train Station: Cascais. Also known as the town beach, it's a lively spot perfect for families and those looking to immerse themselves in the local atmosphere, with plenty of amenities nearby. There's usually a spirited foot volley game rockin' and plenty of locals and tourists dipping into the water.
sources.shortName: 27 Most Stunning Cascais Portugal Beaches (2024)

sources.snippet: The Praia da Ribeira is the central beach of Cascais, overlooking the fishing harbour and the fort. Historically, fishing boats were pulled onto the beach, and it is still frequently referred to as Praia dos Pescadores (fishermen's beach). As this beach is in the centre of town, beachgoers may feel that they are being constantly gazed over, due to the constant stream of day-trippers wandering past the beach.
sources.shortName: Cascais beaches and beach guide for 2025

sources.snippet: Praia da Ribeira de Cascais, also known as Fisherman‚Äôs Beach, is a charming and vibrant beach located in the heart of Cascais. Its location near the seaside town‚Äôs historic center made it so easy to access, but that also means it gets easily crowded. With its lively atmosphere, colorful fishing boats, and fresh seafood restaurants lining the shore, it offers a delightful coastal experience.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Beaches in Cascais Portugal: Beach Guide

sources.snippet: Let me introduce you to the most central beach in Cascais, located in the heart of Cascais Bay, right next to the 5th of October Square, where you‚Äôll find the Town Hall and the tourist office. The picturesque Seixas Palace stands nearby, offering a lovely viewpoint in the back. For a hotel just steps away from this beach, the Hotel Baia is an excellent choice.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Cascais and Estoril

places.name: Praia da Ribeira de Cascais

reviews.text: Bigger beach, but the water in August was extremely cold for me to enter. There were also boats here, but... it doesn't matter when you can't swim either way. Some kids were playing on an inflatable aqua park, I admire their cold resistance

Cascais Beach is a true seaside paradise. With its crystal-clear waters, golden sands, and breathtaking landscapes, it's the perfect place to relax and soak in the natural beauty of Portugal. Every sunset here is a must-see spectacle.
The beach had wide expanses of fine sand, perfect for sunbathing, although the water was still chilly for swimming during our visit in May.
